annotation.TEXT: Trash Attack is something of a light screen-clearing weapon (though on that note, I've also seen a lot of people compare it to being a much better version of Power Stone). The trash that flies out from it explodes on hitting enemies, which also deals multiple hits. Additionally, using this weapon in mid-air also causes Mega Man to hop slightly (essentially giving him a small double-jump).

Of all the bosses in this game, Wizard Man is the one that honestly gives me the most trouble. I know it's possible to manipulate his homing shots, but for one reason or another, I'm just not that good at fighting him normally. If there is one saving grace to this however, it's that he takes a bit more damage from the buster than the other bosses (hence the "Squishy Wizard" trope).
On an important note: Mage Metools only shoot at you if you press the fire button (this is why using a charge shot against them is the best option, as they won't retaliate with their own attack).

The fire in this stage acts a bit differently than most other hazards. Touching it will damage you at a near constant rate (essentially speeding up your invincibility frames without causing knock-back). Thankfully, it doesn't effect you through invincibility gained from hitting an enemy. You can also use the Soak Rain to put these fires out as well.

Flash Dagger is probably the weakest weapon in SFR's set, but even then, it still manages to be pretty good. Aside from having rapid fire capabilities, you can also hold a dagger in place by holding down the fire button. If you do this for long enough, Mega Man will gain brief invincibility time.

With that being said, there is one thing that can effect you through invincibility frames: the lava. While I don't exactly agree with this, I can still understand why the lava acts this way (I mean...it is lava, after all). Thankfully however, this is the only stage in the entire game with the equivalent of MM1-based spikes.

Fun Fact: The gravestones in this stage depict the Robot Masters from Mr. Weird Guy's previous attempt at a fan-game. I was actually able to recognize at least two of them, though I did have to consult to the original Trash Man level video for a full list of names. So for those of you curious, the fallen RM's include: Pollen Woman, Molten Man, Battery Man, Knife Man, Mystic Man, Missile Man, Cactus Man, and Aero Man.

Potential tip for those interested in speedrunning: Quick-switch to another weapon after hitting Trash Man with the Coal Barrage. The coal itself deals 4 damage to him, while the fire-trail deals 2. It's much faster to hit him, despawn the fire-trail by quick-switching, then hit him with another Coal Barrage.

Coal Barrage is another strong weapon that effects a large area in front of you. The projectiles are enough to kill almost any of the regular enemies (especially at point-blank range), but it also has an added fire-trail that damages anything lingering inside it. Notably however, while you can use this weapon underwater, doing so won't produce the fire-trail (the coal pieces themselves will still work).
Beyond that, I don't have much else to say about Trash Man, other than that he happens to suffer from Metal Man syndrome (he's weak to his own weapon).

Don't jump into this upcoming teleporter if you're going for the letter (doing so increases your descending velocity just enough to hit the spikes). Instead, just walk into it. Getting all of the letters will unlock Beat, who - instead of retrieving items or saving you from pits - will now proceed to rapidly fire deadly, piercing lasers at everything he sees.

Magic Missile is a pretty basic, but very strong homing attack. You can aim the projectiles up or down to sway them towards specific enemies, and if it destroys them, the shot continues to seek out another enemy. You can only have two of these shots on-screen at the same time, but really, that's sometimes all you'll need to plow through a room with this weapon.
As another neat reference, the mid-boss of this stage is Battery Man, who is still alive (sorta). While I could just roast him with the Coal Barrage, I actually need to save its ammo for Trash Man.
